newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open $10 a tonne lower.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open $10 a tonne lower.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $10 lower Thursday as a stronger dollar against Sterling overnight is expected to weigh on the New York market, traders said.
In London, cocoa futures were firmer in light dealings early Thursday. At the midday break, LIFFE July was up three stg at 1,006 stg, the day's high.

Wednesday, New York cocoa futures ended broadly higher in light trading. July closed up $19 at $1,428 a tonne after ranging from $1,432 to $1,420. Spot May, which expires in a week, ended $24 higher at $1,423, while the back months gained $16 to $18.

Technically, traders pegged support for July at $1,420-$1,418, a small chart gap formed Wednesday. Resistance at yesterday's high of $1,432, with a more substantial upside hurdle seen at $1,440-$1,443.
